Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> Hello, I was wondering if anyone else who sent their CHIPS to a VerusAgama address when the AGAMA vulnerability issues took place is now having an issue sending the CHIPS out of their VerusAGAMA wallet? I get an "invalid pub key" error when trying to send them out of the wallet.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <PHBA2061> the issue is known back then, because Verus Agama doesn't recognize CHIPS address format

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> So we can send them TO versus agama, but cannot yet send them back out?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> I was able to successfully send them to a newly created seed in Verus Agama back in June, but have not tried to move them again until today.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <PHBA2061> to send them out you need to use another wallet, CHIPS QT for example <https://github.com/DeckerSU/chips3/releases/tag/v0.14.99_decker_2>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> So I can use my seed from VerusAgama with that wallet to access my coins?

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <PHBA2061> a lot of people in this Discord have used that, but I use a CLI wallet, so I'm not 100% sure it has an option to import your seed or not

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> Would like to avoid the 153 GB blockchain download as well, if possible.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> Thanks for the info.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <PHBA2061> how about 3Gb ? CHIPS only takes about 3.1 Gb

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> Nice!

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> Much better

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <PHBA2061> if you stuck while syncing or if it is slow, try manually adding some nodes from this <http://chips.komodochainz.info/network>

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <Chief Crypto> I don't see any way to use QT wallet to get my CHIPS out of Verus Agama wallet, unfortunately. 

There must be some other folks who migrated their coins to Verus Agama in June and have the same problem. Not sure what to do to free the coins. I never would have sent them in to the Verus Agama if I knew they would be trapped there, but people were saying it was safe at the time.

Author: Gateway#3763
Content:
[dscrd-chips] <phm87> @Chief Crypto  I don't know how to put a seed into a CLI daemon. Usually, I convert the seed to a WIF (privatekey) that I import into the coin daemon. To convert the seed to the CHIPS WIF, I use Decker's tool (I note down the address and the WIF):
https://docs.komodoplatform.com/notary/generate-privkeys-third-party-coins-from-passphrase.html#install-dependencies
Then when you have the private key (WIF) you can import it:
```chips-cli importprivkey XXXXX```

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <phm87> (Please never share your private keys nor your seeds)

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <phm87> The importprivkey will take a while, please do not stop the command/prompt. You can check what is going on from another terminal by checking CHIPS debug.log : ``tail -f .chips/debug.log``

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <phm87> When it did finish, you must check that the address is properly imported : ``chips-cli validateaddress Address`` (on the address, not on the WIF), if you see mine:true it is perfect

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <phm87> from the output of Decker's tool, the "Compressed WIF" is the WIF (privatekey) when the "Compressed Address" is the address

Author: Gateway#3763
Content: [dscrd-chips] <phm87> Remark : there are other tools to convert a seed into a WIF
